image.altText: Stella  hugs her daughter as they walk along the footpath outside the District Court

props.synopsis: A woman who was abused at the hands of her ex-partner – a former police detective – says she felt "silenced" after reaching out to SA Police, a court has heard. Their daughter also recounted his abuse and said she no longer considered him her father.

title.children: 'I will not be silenced': Woman confronts abusive ex-cop husband in court

image.altText: A flood approaches a small outback town surrounded by a levy

props.synopsis: Emergency services say road closures around the remote South Australian town of Innamincka are likely to be in place for months, prompting concern about the local tourism industry.

title.children: As floodwaters recede, Innamincka locals face long wait for roads to re-open

image.altText: Aerial view into a car showing a driver resting a mobile phone on their lap

props.synopsis: Police have issued more than 46,000 fines in six months to Adelaide drivers caught using mobile phones and are "disappointed" at the number of repeat offenders – including one driver detected 41 times.

title.children: Driver caught on mobile phone detection cameras 41 times

image.altText: Willie Rioli celebrates

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide forward Willie Rioli missed club training on Tuesday morning in the wake of the furore around his social media post about Hawthorn.

title.children: Rioli granted day off as club supports forward following social media post

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in Adelaide

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has confirmed that if he is re-elected, his party will formally bid for South Australia to host a future International Climate Change Conference.

title.children: PM wants Australia to co-host 2026 UN climate conference

image.altText: A wind sock surrounded by markers next to an air strip

props.synopsis: A man has died after a plane he was piloting crashed into an airstrip in White Cliffs this morning.

title.children: Pilot dead after aircraft crashes onto runway in far west NSW

image.altText: A sun setting behind clouds at Lake Menindee in outback NSW.

props.synopsis: As a mass of water makes its way down from Queensland, the Menindee Lakes in outback New South Wales could be the beneficiary. Having slowly dried up for months, the fortunes of the bird and fish sanctuary may be about to change.

title.children: Up to 1 trillion litres of floodwater heading for Menindee Lakes in outback NSW

image.altText: A man holds a photo of an elderly woman

props.synopsis: An elderly man who fatally stabbed his wife to death at their suburban Adelaide home in December 2023 has died after being found mentally unfit to stand trial — but mentally competent at the time of the crime.

title.children: Francesco Dimasi, who fatally stabbed wife Maria, dies aged 93

image.altText: A blonde man in a suit walking and being followed by a pack of reporters who are holding microhphones

props.synopsis: Former SA Liberal leader David Speirs crushed a "rock" of cocaine on his kitchen bench and supplied it to two men, including a man he knew was attending Narcotics Anonymous, a court document reveals.

title.children: Former SA Liberal leader supplied drugs to Narcotics Anonymous attendee, court documents reveal

image.altText: Cyclist Melissa Hoskins smiles during an interview.

props.synopsis: The mother of former Olympic cyclist Melissa Hoskins has told an Adelaide court she accepts her daughter's death was a "tragic accident".

title.children: Mother of Melissa Hoskins says Olympian's death was a 'tragic accident'

image.altText: A man in a check shirt leans on a gate

props.synopsis: South Australian independent MP Nick McBride is facing multiple counts of assaulting a person known to him, after he was arrested and charged last week.

title.children: South Australian MP Nick McBride arrested and charged with assault

image.altText: A smiling blonde woman and a grey-haired man smile while standing next a tuna catch on a waterfront.

props.synopsis: Australian tuna producers are cheering after the industry received a sustainability certification following years of hard work.

title.children: World-first certification for once 'severely overfished' Australian tuna

image.altText: Bob Katter reading a document in his office

props.synopsis: Herding Bob Katter is not an easy task for his long-suffering but loyal staff, who battle to keep him on message. But when he wanders, it can turn into viral gold.

title.children: Bob Katter's never lost for words, but there's one topic that's off limits

image.altText: Two young girls with Port Adelaide guernseys and coloured face paint smile for a photo

props.synopsis: The magic of Gather Round can be hard to place, but on the ground in Adelaide the excitement of footy-loving youngsters is contagious and reminds us all why we fell in love with the game in the first place.

title.children: Gather Round gets its magic from recreating our childlike love of footy

image.altText: An oval sign under a shop verandah saying sacat.

props.synopsis: A South Australian nurse has been reprimanded by South Australia's Civil and Administrative Tribunal after admitting to fabricating documents in a bid to gain employment.

title.children: SA nurse banned after committing 'serious' professional misconduct

image.altText: Three men sit on a couch with blue wall paper behind them

props.synopsis: Streaming may have increased distribution opportunities for emerging filmmakers, but with limited box office opportunities, is rags-to-riches-success a thing of the past?

title.children: Napoleon Dynamite and Mad Max are indi success stories. Can it still happen?

image.altText: An Aboriginal man wearing protective gloves holding a hot container with heated grass in it.

props.synopsis: In far west New South Wales, two Aboriginal men are drawing on the traditional knowledge of their ancestors to generate a source of income.

title.children: Aboriginal entrepreneurs harness ancient knowledge for new businesses

image.altText: A man looks through prison bars.

props.synopsis: To survive the Syrian prison known as the "human slaughterhouse", Moaz had to live a lie. Then it got real.

title.children: Moaz faked being a doctor. Then he was asked to do something terrifying

image.altText: Douglas Boyd conducting the Adelaide Symphony Orchestra in concert at the Adelaide Town Hall.

props.synopsis: Adelaide's culture of music has garnered global recognition, but some arts leaders say there's a missing piece of the puzzle.

title.children: 'A sore point': Adelaide's long wait for a purpose-built concert hall

image.altText: A micro chip seen on a circuit board

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says new levies on semiconductor imports into the US will be announced in the coming week, with their "national security" impacts to be investigated.

title.children: Trump to impose new chip tariffs, including on electronics exempted days ago

image.altText: Donald Trump and Nayib Bukele stand at a White House entrance.

props.synopsis: As world leaders scramble to get the ear of US President Donald Trump, the self-described "world's coolest dictator" scores a coveted White House meeting.

title.children: 'World's coolest dictator' meets Trump after jailing US deportees

image.altText: Two people look at the statue of liberty

props.synopsis: As the Trump administration continues its crackdown on border security, more Australians appear to be avoiding the US.

title.children: Fewer Australians travelling to US amid 'scary' border security crackdown

image.altText: Lady Gaga stands outstretched with a white cape flowing. She wears some armour mixed in with a white linen outfit.

props.synopsis: The highs, lows and biggest surprises from the most talked about music festival on the planet.

title.children: Lady Gaga dazzles Coachella while Amyl and the Sniffers get political

image.altText: the outside of a building

props.synopsis: Australia's dollar has recovered from last week's heavy losses, and the ASX200 has closed up modestly. Catch up on the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Dollar recovers from pummelling, ASX closes higher — as it happened

image.altText: albanese dutton split

props.synopsis: On Sunday alone, Labor and the Coalition unveiled almost $24 billion in spending. Neither side has detailed how the new promises will be funded, or where the offsetting savings or tax cuts will come from.

title.children: Australia's 'fat and unprepared' budget not helped by 'hold my beer' election

image.altText: A man with dyed blonde hair with black roots in a white collared shirt stands outside near a tall glass apartment building.

props.synopsis: Voters tell ABC's Your Say campaign they are struggling more than ever with housing costs.

title.children: Voters unhappy negative gearing, stamp duty not on horizon this election

image.altText: A smiling man in a hat and sunglasses sits on a boat.

props.synopsis: Brett Williams had "2.1 million reasons" not to kill Craig Dunn on the day the sale of his property was to be finalised, when the tenant who made his life a living hell would finally be out of his life.

title.children: Widow tells of dreams stolen by landlord who killed her husband

image.altText: A composite image of two posters of Zoe Daniel and Tim Wilson.

props.synopsis: Across the historically conservative stronghold of Goldstein, voters are tuning in for a federal election rematch between the Liberals and the teals. These are some of the issues on their minds.

title.children: 'They've had their time': Can a teal MP win a second go in Goldstein?

image.altText: Uncle Carey wearing a blue shirt.

props.synopsis: A large majority of Aboriginal community-owned health facilities in Victoria are in urgent need of infrastructure funding, according to a new report from the state's top advisory body and peak body for Indigenous health.

title.children: Indigenous elders say crumbling health facilities are fracturing community

image.altText: A young homeless person sits on a park bench with their back to the camera. You cannot see their face.

props.synopsis: Every four days a homeless person aged between 15 and 24 dies, and the majority of deaths are due to suicide.

title.children: Every four days a young homeless person dies. Advocates want urgent reform

image.altText: Wikipedia's home page under a magnifying glass.

props.synopsis: A single bot generated and published millions of articles on the largest non-English version of Wikipedia. The results caused a rift among editors — and a glimpse of what the online encyclopedia might face from AI.

title.children: The second-largest Wikipedia was so controversial it was nearly deleted

image.altText: A composite image of two women, one Liah Yoo

props.synopsis: American beauty founders are warning prices are likely to go up as the global skincare and cosmetics industry comes to terms with Donald Trump's new tariff regime.

title.children: 'Hurts me so much': How Trump caused chaos in the K-beauty world

image.altText: A woman in a blazer and a pearl necklace

props.synopsis: Independents Monique Ryan and David Pocock say content made by social media creators paid for by politicians should be disclosed.

title.children: Monique Ryan says paid influencer posts must be disclosed after awkward on-air moment

image.altText: A person with long hair and glasses smiles while sitting inside a shed.

props.synopsis: Hobart-based performer Quin Thomson embarks on medical transition amid service shortages, as Tasmanian GPs working with trans and gender-diverse patients close their books.

title.children: 'My voice has been my living': Soprano's sacrifice for gender transition
